name: TownePlace Suites Denver Tech Center

reviews.text: This hotel was awesome. The front desk staff (especially Melissa) were EXTREMELY helpful and courteous!! The rooms were clean and very well kept; the breakfast was complimentary and good. Good location with food andmall nearby. I would definitely use this hotel again!
reviews.title: Great experience!!

reviews.text: This hotel was fabulous, esp. as a person with a disability. There were ground level suites for disabled patrons. My shower didn't have a shower chair in it as it was supposed to, so the staff immediately went out and purchased one since they were unable to quickly locate it. Very nice part of town in a business park so during the workday it could get a little busy, but after work hours it was nice and quiet. Within 1/2 mile of the Light Rail station at Dry Creek and it took me right to Mile High Stadium. It was more convenient than staying at this hotel's downtown location (though that is equally nice) because of the Light Rail station being so close. The staff were courteous and it was also nice to be able to print my boarding pass at the courtesy computer in the lobby. Now that I've been there I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else while in the Denver area. Kudos!
reviews.title: My new home in Denver!

reviews.text: Good location in Englewood, quiet- until the Ikea is built- then traffic might pick up. Rooms are clean, kitchen is good. Workout room has one StarTrac treadmill and Reebok bike- no weights. Breakfast- simple- cereal, juice coffee, bagel, packeaged muffins. Wireless works and is free.
reviews.title: Average Hotel
hotel didn't register our booking - sad experience
reviews.text: We thought we would have done a big deal when we booked this hotel for a 24hour special tariff on expedia. That's why we decide to choose this hotel not easy to find if you arrive from Germany for the first time in denver and have to find it with your rental car on a dark evening. But with the help of google maps we tired but happy arrived at 10p.m. But then a nightmare happened. The young girl at the reception didn't know anything of the booking and couldn't find our confirmed reservation. The manager wasn't there and couldn't be called to find a solution. So the young girl only offered us a room for the regular high price or to leave the hotel in the night. The regular price was about 3 to 4 times higher then the super 24hour offer and for this price we easily could stay at an airport hotel. As it was so late we decided to stay and told her that we wanted to talk to the manger the next morning. The room we were given was not that we had ordered - a quiet room away from hallway. It was just the first room next to the reception and the fitness room with loud television (as nobody was in there in the evening, we switched the tv and the light off). The room was a little dated, especially the kitchen. For a special rate it would have been OK, but for the high rate it was a joke. In the night we send an email to Germany where there was already the next morning and we got an answer that they would inform the hotel about our confirmed booking. Then we went to bed for a short night as the fitness area was loud again in the morning. When we went to the reception to ask for the manager there was an other woman (some older then the girl from the evening) and she said, the super offer we had booked was really cheap but they wouldn't charge us more from the credit card - not the high price the girl offered us the evening before. After returning home 3 weeks later we saw that this was true. so after all it was only a horrible start of our visit in the United States but at least not an expensive one. We think the hotel management should learn from this. For an english speaking person from the US a not booked hotel is quite an awful experience, but to give an foreign guest not familiar with the language and the rights as tourist only the alternative to accept the highest price for a dated room or to leave the hotel late in the night is really a nightmare.

Fortunately this was the worst experience of our holidays what after this start was quite nice. The hotel itself looks nice from outside, lots of parking, no traffic, clean rooms. The outdoor pool was closed although it was about 75-80°F.
reviews.title: Dilapidated facilities, extremely rude and unaccomidating manager. Don't stay here!!!

reviews.text: EXTREMELY HELPFUL staff! I had a crisis and needed my keys shipped to me while I was out traveling for work. Raul and Brett were the front desk employees that did everything they could to make sure I got my keys. They even tried shipping them same day. I got my keys the next day in a timely manner and it just shows how great their customer service is. I am staying here for 30 days and it is nice to stay with a hotel that is there for the guests.
reviews.title: Extremely helpful staff and a great long term stay hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed one night while on business and for the most part we didn't have a bad stay. The location was great as far as dining/shopping options and was very close to I-25.
reviews.title: Good Location.

reviews.text: All the staff we encountered were very nice and helpful. The room was OK but all the furniture was very old and we sctually had to keep ourselves from slidping off the sofa and chair! The bed was confortabe and we slept well.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: Having stayed at other Towneplace Suite locations and knowing how noisy they can be, we asked for a room on the top floor and had no problems regarding noise.
reviews.title: This place frequently oversells

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would say this place is OK, but you can get more confort for a better price at many other hotels in the area.
reviews.title: Great for the price
Not upscale, but great stay
reviews.text: A colleague and I stayed a this property for four nights on a business trip, and it was a good hotel in a perfect location. We had a two bedroom suite with a small kitchen and a nice-size living/dining room. We were both able to work at the kitchen table with computers and papers spread out. That was especially nice so we didn't have to be cramped at a desk or on beds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free breakfast was fine, no frills, but cereal, yogurt, breads/pastries and coffee/tea/juice. We also took advantage of a large laundry facility.
reviews.title: Nice Looking Room, Could Have Been Cleaner

reviews.text: The location was excellent with many restaurants (fast food, chain and local) very close by, as well as a large, upscale mall, shops and all kinds of places.
reviews.title: Nice Marriott Property in a safe area of metro Denver

reviews.text: The room was a little worn, but it was very clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: great guest service-even though i didn't stay

reviews.text: We were looking forward to staying at this hotel as it looked very nice from the pictures. The room looked very nice when we first walked it, everything was new and modern. There was a full kitchen and well supplied with everything needed to live there for awhile. The fridge was an apartment size unit as was the stove, very useable. One complaint with the fridge was that it was very load and rattled when it was running. Once we started settling into the room we started noticing little issues. There wasn't really anywhere for the TV, it was pushed up against a wall and was completely unwatchable from the bed, I had to pull the stand away from the wall almost a foot to turn the TV enough that we could see it from the bed, then it was in the walkway making it difficult to sneak around to go to the kitchen or bathroom. The bathroom had not been completely cleaned, don't know if it was started or not? There was a well used bar of soap on the sink ledge, and I'm sure the sink hadn't been cleaned if the used soap wasn't moved. I informed the front desk about the bathroom and the loud fridge, they assured me they would get it fixed up right away. Half an hour later I was told there was nothing they could do about the fridge and the hotel was full so another room was not an option. We went out for dinner returning 2 1/2 hours later and the bathromm still had not been tended to. Sleep quality was so-so, the room was right next to an exit and the fire door was slamming steady for a good part of the night. The breakfast was very basic, only two tables to sit at and very poorly supplied.
reviews.title: No frills, great staff, great price

reviews.text: I attended some business meetings in the Denver area and reserved a room at this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel overbooked and I was bumped to another hotel. Normally this wouldn't have been too much of an issue. However, the hotel that they moved me to was miles away from the original hotel and in the opposite direction of the location of my meeting - even though there are tons of hotels in the DTC area. Why in the world would they send a bumped guest to a hotel so far away? Also, I was travelling with colleagues and we had all reserved rooms in the same hotel so that we could have meet at breakfast to prepare for our regular meetings, carpool, etc. I was only one of our group moved to a different hotel, which was a real hassle. In the end though, it turned out to be a blessing in disguise since my colleagues had plenty of trouble with things not working at the Towneplace Suites.
reviews.title: Bumped
Not so great
reviews.text: I should have checked reviews before booking! Housekeeping was minimal-- changed out the towels and emptied trash, but that was it for four days. Renovations made the gym sporadically available, and that did not please my daughter at all. Deborah, the breakfast room lady, was delightful, and the location is great. However, I won't be staying here again.
Stayed 3 weeks in the hotel, they are doing major renovations, this means laundry room is closed, gym is closed, elevators functioning sporadically, loud noise all day.
reviews.title: UNDER MAJOR RENOVATION
Extras not expected for the price, very friendly
reviews.text: Our water was shut of for an entire day.
Housekeeping staff do a really poor job cleaning the rooms
reviews.title: Clean and friendly

aka: Towneplace Suites Denver Tech Hotel Englewood
description: As a first choice among Denver Tech Center hotels, the Marriott TownePlace Suites Denver Tech Center provides exceptional short and extended stay suites in Denver south. Located in the Mile High city’s 2nd largest business hub, our Denver suite hotel is just 10 minutes from downtown and close to top corporations, businesses, and Denver attractions. With such a convenient location & apartment-style accommodations, the TownePlace Suites Denver Tech Center hotel is ideal for Denver corporate housing, long stays and business travel. Each of our extended stay hotel suites features a fully-equipped kitchen, flat screen TV, spacious living area, and well-lit work desk. High-speed wireless Internet is available throughout our hotel and we offer a free daily breakfast buffet. Take advantage of our full-service business center, hotel fitness center, and outdoor pool. Whether you’re here for business or for a relaxing Colorado vacation, enjoy an outstanding stay at the TownePlace Suites Denver Tech Center!
